title.narrative: Provision of nutrition services to the drought affected population in the target districts of Sar-e-Pul province.

description.narrative:
The proposed project, chiefly focusing on hard-to-reach areas, will be solely implemented by ORCD as the BPHS implementing partner of MoPH in Sar-e-Pul province targeting drought affected population without creating any duplication and without creating pull factors providing them at the place of origin. Facilitating the provision of comprehensive package of nutrition interventions as per BPHS 2010, the project will be implemented in Gosfandi, Sancharak, Sarepul and Sozma Qala districts specifically addressing women, girls, people with disability and elders. Contributing to the delivery of 2018-2021 HRP, the program interventions related to nutrition as part of this project are based on a comprehensive needs assessment conducted by a team comprised of male and female experts.
ORCD will deploy staff as per guidelines introduced by MoPH for two mobile nutrition teams (1 midwife, nutrition officer and support staff) serving underserved areas in the districts (Gosfandi, Sancharak, Sarepul, and Sozma Qala). The mobile nutrition teams will be working in the areas beyond the reach of the existing health facilities as part of nutrition mobile activity. The mobile teams are greatly needed because the existing BPHS does not have any mobile health team while there are drought affected population whose needs especially nutrition cannot be made by the existing health facilities. In the view of this, two standalone mobile nutrition teams are greatly needed. The mobile teams will be established as part of this project which will chiefly provide nutrition services integrated with health under BPHS program. The mobile nutrition teams will greatly complement the existing BPHS program in tackling the nutrition needs of the drought affected population in the target districts.
In the view of this, the nutrition mobile teams will tackle both supply side and demand side factors. On demand side aspect, they will strengthen community-based nutrition interventions i.e. increased case findings, growth monitoring, screening, referrals, and conducting counselling related to IYCF practices to a total 3,600 mothers. On supply side, they will offer, emergency care, assessment and diagnosis, pretreatment of SAM treatment of acute malnutrition of MAM, follow-up assessment of nutrition situation and screening and growth monitoring of all under five children. The team will also involve mothers in improving the nutrition of their children.
In addition, aimed at promoting IYCF in emergency, ORCD will establish breastfeeding corners in a total 23 HFs: 5 HFs in Gosfandi, 6 HFs in Sancharak, 9 HFs in Sar-e-Pul Center and 3 HFs in Sozma Qala districts.
